alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:16PM CDT until June 14 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL ST. CLAIR COUNTY... At 216 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ohatchee to near Logan Martin Lake to near Coosa Island, moving southeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Pell City, Ragland, Coosa Island, Harrisburg, Neely Henry Lake, Logan Martin Lake, St. Clair County Airport, Neely Henry Dam and Cropwell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
